text: [Music]
posting tweets here the internet's
busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of the new
benny the butcher album
burden of proof this is the newest
full-length lp
from benny the butcher a buffalo rapper
whose profile has been growing pretty
quickly alongside his brothers in
arms west side gun and conway
of griselda records since doing their
own label deal connecting with jay-z
and releasing music on eminem's shady
records
griselda has been one of the most
talked-about commodities
in hip-hop today and with their latest
projects
each respective member is trying to take
the best advantage of their newfound
connections
there was conway's well-groomed
versatile and
excellent new project west's side has
been packing his records with some
pretty big features
and now benny has hit us with this new
one with production from none other than
hit boy
from end to end so sonically i'm kind of
expecting a jump here from his
early rugged mixtapes and raw high water
marks like tana talk 3.
this is the second full-length project
that hit boy has had his fingerprints
all over this year
earlier it was naza's king's disease so
i think it's pretty significant to be
the next artist to get that rare honor
especially since he's helped
elevate benny's sound here to rich and
luxurious new heights
it's kind of like hearing his clever
coke raps transition from the corner to
the penthouse
with fat beats classy horns mesmerizing
samples and well-known features
this is benny the butcher's big time a
sink or swim moment where he actually
sounds like he is floating comfortably
i guess he's not lying on the first
track when he says yo last year was
about brandon
this one about expandin caught a flight
to cali made 24 i landed
this rap [ __ ] easy to tell the truth i
can't stand it
one other upside to this project for me
is that it's one of those records where
the review
kind of writes itself everything that is
quality about the record just kind of
hits you on the head hit boy's versatile
colorful hard-hitting beats
benny sharp lyricism his cold-blooded
demeanor
the gritty details in the pictures he
paints plus some
impressive personal moments on the back
end of the record too
whether that be on thank god i made it
where he's going over the hardships and
obstacles that he had to pass
to get where he is today his mom
struggling to keep things together
his brother dying young and seeing him
in his nephew's eyes
it's absolutely heartbreaking and a
testament to just how well benny's
emotions translate through his words and
flows
there's the track legend where benny is
going over the success and legend status
he has achieved up until this point
while dropping some
great lyrical gems put my hood in
diamond so you know how my block did it
gun come with a carfax you know who i
shot with it i beat a lot of charges
this money you got a pardon i'm a boss
so my host to boujee for olive garden
even war paint with conway and west
side gun gets personal and introspective
to a degree
typically when these three line up on a
track it is sure to be a barn burner but
it's actually a change of pace between
benny's paranoia around being pushed
back into his old ways
and conway being shocked about where his
talents have taken him
it definitely reveals a lot about both
their characters plus the
shimmering nostalgic pitched soul
samples that
are laced into the beat definitely help
sell it too
so yeah i think burden of proof's
qualities
speak for themselves maybe the most
lacking thing about it
are the features the biggest of which
seemed to make the smallest impact
on the record rick ross definitely fits
the luxurious vibe of where would i go
but outside of referencing back to his
old pistol whipping charges his
feature is pretty spaced out and typical
then there's the song timeless which
first off
great b there are some dark club
friendly rhythms topped with sinister
melodies that
transition from one passage of the song
to the next but there are features from
both
lil wayne and big sean on this one which
is an odd pairing at best
stylistically these guys are cut from
such different cloths than benny
crossovers with rick ross and freddie
gibbs for example
just seem to make way more sense either
way though lil wayne's flow
is relentless even if his lyricism isn't
ambitious
and then big sean doesn't derail things
so that's good uh part of me wonders if
it was benny's plan to make sure
nobody is really stepping to him on this
record or even coming close
the only person in that vicinity here is
freddie gibbs
and his appearance is kind of
short-lived outside of that though
burden of proof is a pretty solid record
there's the hard-hitting opener where
hit boy graces us with a beat that jay-z
would have wrapped on in his prime
crispy drums urgent horn and organ
samples
meanwhile benny sounds mean on top of
the track as he reintroduces us to the
wit
and decisions that helped inform his
come up
what he is delivering here isn't just
mindless egoism
it is autobiographical then there's also
sly green which also sounds like a
modern
update on some gangsta rap relic from
the bling era
lyrically benny continues to grow his
aura with bars like
had the trap bumping like acne also the
promo i did
pyrex should be giving me pots plus
these assumptions that he signed an
illuminati deal
one way flight has some cycling dreamy
vocal samples that
really hypnotize and soundtrack a couple
of more great verses from benny
also a fantastic hook from freddy that
line about either crying in this
toyota or you know this maybach
plus his last verse about running his
girls only fans having computer work and
uh buying some ugly white girl whipping
it and turning it to miss
universe freddy does not need a lot of
time to give you a lot to think about
benny also hits us with the dramatic
famous
where it becomes very clear that drug
dealing for him isn't just
something to brag about or something to
prove his i guess
toughness his grit but it's just like a
point of pride in a way
with his first brick he says he felt
famous as opposed to with what he's
doing now where
that same sensation just doesn't come
there's also new streets whose very
nostalgic beat
sets the tone for benny to rap about
essentially being a part of this new
wave but the brevity of it all prevents
the song from having the same level of
impact as many other tracks here
especially the more introspective ones
on the back end at the very end of the
lp
once again i'll say burden of proof is a
relatively solid project
but i didn't come away from this thing
feeling like we got
benny improved or expanded all that far
it was like a richer or
more extravagant version of what i was
already familiar with previously
sure there are some much needed personal
moments on the record that i thought
went over very well
but beyond that benny didn't really go
out of his way to say or state anything
that we didn't already know
or push himself outside of his comfort
zone still though feeling a decent two
strong seven
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video that you could check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel anthony fantano
benny the butcher forever
